The display object to add the

A texture or array of textures to use

If config.emit is explicitly passed as false, the Emitter

PIXI.particles.Particle.name: PIXI.particles.Particle
PIXI.particles.Particle.description: An individual particle image. You shouldn't have to deal with these.

params.name: emitter
params.description: The emitter that controls this particle.

PIXI.particles.ParticleUtils.name: PIXI.particles.ParticleUtils
PIXI.particles.ParticleUtils.description: Contains helper functions for particles and emitters to use.

PIXI.particles.PathParticle.name: PIXI.particles.PathParticle
PIXI.particles.PathParticle.description:
An particle that follows a path defined by an algebraic expression, e.g. "sin(x)" or
"5x + 3".
To use this class, the particle config must have a "path" string in the
"extraData" parameter. This string should have "x" in it to represent movement (from the
speed settings of the particle). It may have numbers, parentheses, the four basic
operations, and the following Math functions or properties (without the preceding "Math."):
"pow", "sqrt", "abs", "floor", "round", "ceil", "E", "PI", "sin", "cos", "tan", "asin",
"acos", "atan", "atan2", "log".
The overall movement of the particle and the expression value become x and y positions for
the particle, respectively. The final position is rotated by the spawn rotation/angle of
the particle.

Some example paths:

	"sin(x/10) * 20" // A sine wave path.
	"cos(x/100) * 30" // Particles curve counterclockwise (for medium speed/low lifetime particles)
	"pow(x/10, 2) / 2" // Particles curve clockwise (remember, +y is down).

params.name: emitter
params.description: The emitter that controls this PathParticle.

classitems.description: Texture array used as each frame of animation, similarly to how MovieClip works.
classitems.name: textures

classitems.description: Duration of the animation, in seconds.
classitems.name: duration

classitems.description: Animation framerate, in frames per second.
classitems.name: framerate

classitems.description: Animation time elapsed, in seconds.
classitems.name: elapsed

classitems.description: If this particle animation should loop.
classitems.name: loop

classitems.description:
Initializes the particle for use, based on the properties that have to
have been set already on the particle.

classitems.description: Sets the textures for the particle.
classitems.name: applyArt

params.name: art
params.description: An array of PIXI.Texture objects for this animated particle.

classitems.description: Updates the particle.
classitems.name: update

params.name: delta
params.description: Time elapsed since the previous frame, in __seconds__.

classitems.description: Destroys the particle, removing references and preventing future use.
classitems.name: destroy

Checks over the art that was passed to the Emitter's init() function, to do any special
modifications to prepare it ahead of time.
classitems.name: parseArt

params.name: art
params.description: The array of art data, properly formatted for AnimatedParticle.

return.description: The art, after any needed modifications.

classitems.description:
The constructor used to create new particles. The default is
the built in particle class.
classitems.name: _particleConstructor

classitems.description: An array of PIXI Texture objects.
classitems.name: particleImages

classitems.description: The starting alpha of all particles.
classitems.name: startAlpha

classitems.description: The ending alpha of all particles.
classitems.name: endAlpha

classitems.description: The starting speed of all particles.
classitems.name: startSpeed

classitems.description: The ending speed of all particles.
classitems.name: endSpeed

classitems.description:
A minimum multiplier for the speed of a particle at both start and
end. A value between minimumSpeedMultiplier and 1 is randomly generated
and multiplied with startSpeed and endSpeed to provide the actual
startSpeed and endSpeed for each particle.
classitems.name: minimumSpeedMultiplier

classitems.description:
Acceleration to apply to particles. Using this disables
any interpolation of particle speed. If the particles do
not have a rotation speed, then they will be rotated to
match the direction of travel.
classitems.name: acceleration

classitems.description:
The maximum speed allowed for accelerating particles. Negative values, values of 0 or NaN
will disable the maximum speed.
classitems.name: maxSpeed

classitems.description: The starting scale of all particles.
classitems.name: startScale

classitems.description: The ending scale of all particles.
classitems.name: endScale

classitems.description:
A minimum multiplier for the scale of a particle at both start and
end. A value between minimumScaleMultiplier and 1 is randomly generated
and multiplied with startScale and endScale to provide the actual
startScale and endScale for each particle.
classitems.name: minimumScaleMultiplier

classitems.description: The starting color of all particles, as red, green, and blue uints from 0-255.
classitems.name: startColor

classitems.description: The ending color of all particles, as red, green, and blue uints from 0-255.
classitems.name: endColor

classitems.description: The minimum lifetime for a particle, in seconds.
classitems.name: minLifetime

classitems.description: The maximum lifetime for a particle, in seconds.
classitems.name: maxLifetime

classitems.description:
The minimum start rotation for a particle, in degrees. This value
is ignored if the spawn type is "burst" or "arc".
classitems.name: minStartRotation

classitems.description:
The maximum start rotation for a particle, in degrees. This value
is ignored if the spawn type is "burst" or "arc".
classitems.name: maxStartRotation

classitems.description:
If no particle rotation should occur. Starting rotation will still
affect the direction in which particles move. If the rotation speed
is set, then this will be ignored.
classitems.name: maxStartRotation

classitems.description:
The minimum rotation speed for a particle, in degrees per second.
This only visually spins the particle, it does not change direction
of movement.
classitems.name: minRotationSpeed

classitems.description:
The maximum rotation speed for a particle, in degrees per second.
This only visually spins the particle, it does not change direction
of movement.
classitems.name: maxRotationSpeed

classitems.description: The blend mode for all particles, as named by PIXI.blendModes.
classitems.name: particleBlendMode

classitems.description:
An easing function for nonlinear interpolation of values. Accepts a single
parameter of time as a value from 0-1, inclusive. Expected outputs are values
from 0-1, inclusive.
classitems.name: customEase

classitems.description:
Extra data for use in custom particles. The emitter doesn't look inside, but
passes it on to the particle to use in init().
classitems.name: extraData

classitems.description: Time between particle spawns in seconds.
classitems.name: _frequency

classitems.description:
Maximum number of particles to keep alive at a time. If this limit
is reached, no more particles will spawn until some have died.
classitems.name: maxParticles

classitems.description:
The amount of time in seconds to emit for before setting emit to false.
A value of -1 is an unlimited amount of time.
classitems.name: emitterLifetime

classitems.description:
Position at which to spawn particles, relative to the emitter's owner's origin.
For example, the flames of a rocket travelling right might have a spawnPos
of {x:-50, y:0}.
to spawn at the rear of the rocket.
To change this, use updateSpawnPos().
classitems.name: spawnPos

classitems.description:
How the particles will be spawned. Valid types are "point", "rectangle",
"circle", "burst", "ring".
classitems.name: spawnType

classitems.description: A reference to the emitter function specific to the spawn type.
classitems.name: _spawnFunc

classitems.description: A rectangle relative to spawnPos to spawn particles inside if the spawn type is "rect".
classitems.name: spawnRect

classitems.description: A circle relative to spawnPos to spawn particles inside if the spawn type is "circle".
classitems.name: spawnCircle

classitems.description: Number of particles to spawn each wave in a burst.
classitems.name: particlesPerWave

classitems.description: Spacing between particles in a burst. 0 gives a random angle for each particle.
classitems.name: particleSpacing

classitems.description: Angle at which to start spawning particles in a burst.
classitems.name: angleStart

classitems.description:
Rotation of the emitter or emitter's owner in degrees. This is added to
the calculated spawn angle.
To change this, use rotate().
classitems.name: rotation

classitems.description:
The world position of the emitter's owner, to add spawnPos to when
spawning particles. To change this, use updateOwnerPos().
classitems.name: ownerPos

classitems.description:
The origin + spawnPos in the previous update, so that the spawn position
can be interpolated to space out particles better.
classitems.name: _prevEmitterPos

classitems.description: If _prevEmitterPos is valid, to prevent interpolation on the first update
classitems.name: _prevPosIsValid

classitems.description: If either ownerPos or spawnPos has changed since the previous update.
classitems.name: _posChanged

classitems.description: If the parent is a ParticleContainer from Pixi V3
classitems.name: _parentIsPC

classitems.description: The display object to add particles to.
classitems.name: _parent

classitems.description: If particles should be added at the back of the display list instead of the front.
classitems.name: addAtBack

classitems.description: The current number of active particles.
classitems.name: particleCount

classitems.description:
If particles should be emitted during update() calls. Setting this to false
stops new particles from being created, but allows existing ones to die out.
classitems.name: _emit

classitems.description:
The timer for when to spawn particles in seconds, where numbers less
than 0 mean that particles should be spawned.
classitems.name: _spawnTimer

classitems.description: The life of the emitter in seconds.
classitems.name: _emitterLife

classitems.description:
The particles that are active and on the display list. This is the first particle in a
linked list.
classitems.name: _activeParticlesFirst

classitems.description:
The particles that are active and on the display list. This is the last particle in a
linked list.
classitems.name: _activeParticlesLast

classitems.description:
The particles that are not currently being used. This is the first particle in a
linked list.
classitems.name: _poolFirst

classitems.description: The original config object that this emitter was initialized with.
classitems.name: _origConfig

classitems.description: The original particle image data that this emitter was initialized with.
classitems.name: _origArt

classitems.description:
Time between particle spawns in seconds. If this value is not a number greater than 0,
it will be set to 1 (particle per second) to prevent infinite loops.
classitems.name: frequency

classitems.description:
The constructor used to create new particles. The default is
the built in Particle class. Setting this will dump any active or
pooled particles, if the emitter has already been used.
classitems.name: particleConstructor

classitems.description: The display object to add particles to. Settings this will dump any active particles.
classitems.name: parent

classitems.description: Sets up the emitter based on the config settings.
classitems.name: init

params.name: art
params.description: A texture or array of textures to use for the particles.

params.name: config
params.description: A configuration object containing settings for the emitter.

classitems.description: Recycles an individual particle.

params.name: particle
params.description: The particle to recycle.

classitems.description: Sets the rotation of the emitter to a new value.
classitems.name: rotate

params.name: newRot
params.description: The new rotation, in degrees.

classitems.description: Changes the spawn position of the emitter.
classitems.name: updateSpawnPos

params.name: x
params.description: The new x value of the spawn position for the emitter.

params.name: y
params.description: The new y value of the spawn position for the emitter.

classitems.description:
Changes the position of the emitter's owner. You should call this if you are adding
particles to the world display object that your emitter's owner is moving around in.
classitems.name: updateOwnerPos

params.name: x
params.description: The new x value of the emitter's owner.

params.name: y
params.description: The new y value of the emitter's owner.

classitems.description:
Prevents emitter position interpolation in the next update.
This should be used if you made a major position change of your emitter's owner
that was not normal movement.
classitems.name: resetPositionTracking

classitems.description:
If particles should be emitted during update() calls. Setting this to false
stops new particles from being created, but allows existing ones to die out.
classitems.name: emit

classitems.description: Updates all particles spawned by this emitter and emits new ones.
classitems.name: update

params.name: delta
params.description: Time elapsed since the previous frame, in __seconds__.

params.name: emitPosX

params.name: emitPosY

params.name: i

params.name: emitPosX
params.description: The emitter's x position

params.name: emitPosY
params.description: The emitter's y position

params.name: emitPosX
params.description: The emitter's x position

params.name: emitPosY
params.description: The emitter's y position

params.name: i

classitems.description: Positions a particle for a burst type emitter.

classitems.description: Kills all active particles immediately.
classitems.name: cleanup

classitems.description: Destroys the emitter and all of its particles.

classitems.description: The emitter that controls this particle.
classitems.name: emitter

classitems.description:
The velocity of the particle. Speed may change, but the angle also
contained in velocity is constant.
classitems.name: velocity

classitems.description: The maximum lifetime of this particle, in seconds.
classitems.name: maxLife

classitems.description: The current age of the particle, in seconds.
classitems.name: age

classitems.description:
A simple easing function to be applied to all properties that
are being interpolated.
classitems.name: ease

classitems.description: Extra data that the emitter passes along for custom particles.
classitems.name: extraData

classitems.description: The alpha of the particle at the start of its life.
classitems.name: startAlpha

classitems.description: The alpha of the particle at the end of its life.
classitems.name: endAlpha

classitems.description: The speed of the particle at the start of its life.
classitems.name: startSpeed

classitems.description: The speed of the particle at the end of its life.
classitems.name: endSpeed

classitems.description: Acceleration to apply to the particle.
classitems.name: accleration

classitems.description:
The maximum speed allowed for accelerating particles. Negative values, values of 0 or NaN
will disable the maximum speed.
classitems.name: maxSpeed

classitems.description: The scale of the particle at the start of its life.
classitems.name: startScale

classitems.description: The scale of the particle at the start of its life.
classitems.name: endScale

classitems.description: The tint of the particle at the start of its life.
classitems.name: startColor

classitems.description:
The red tint of the particle at the start of its life.
This is pulled from startColor in init().
classitems.name: _sR

classitems.description:
The green tint of the particle at the start of its life.
This is pulled from startColor in init().
classitems.name: _sG

classitems.description:
The blue tint of the particle at the start of its life.
This is pulled from startColor in init().
classitems.name: _sB

classitems.description: The tint of the particle at the start of its life.
classitems.name: endColor

classitems.description:
The red tint of the particle at the end of its life.
This is pulled from endColor in init().
classitems.name: _eR

classitems.description:
The green tint of the particle at the end of its life.
This is pulled from endColor in init().
classitems.name: _sG

classitems.description:
The blue tint of the particle at the end of its life.
This is pulled from endColor in init().
classitems.name: _sB

classitems.description: If alpha should be interpolated at all.
classitems.name: _doAlpha

classitems.description: If scale should be interpolated at all.
classitems.name: _doScale

classitems.description: If speed should be interpolated at all.
classitems.name: _doSpeed

classitems.description:
If acceleration should be handled at all. _doSpeed is mutually exclusive with this,
and _doSpeed gets priority.
classitems.name: _doAcceleration

classitems.description: If color should be interpolated at all.
classitems.name: _doColor

classitems.description:
If normal movement should be handled. Subclasses wishing to override movement
can set this to false in init().
classitems.name: _doNormalMovement

classitems.description: One divided by the max life of the particle, saved for slightly faster math.
classitems.name: _oneOverLife

classitems.description: Reference to the next particle in the list.
classitems.name: next

classitems.description: Reference to the previous particle in the list.
classitems.name: prev

classitems.description:
Initializes the particle for use, based on the properties that have to
have been set already on the particle.
classitems.name: init

classitems.description: A reference to init, so that subclasses can access it without the penalty of Function.call()
classitems.name: Particle_init

classitems.description:
Sets the texture for the particle. This can be overridden to allow
for an animated particle.
classitems.name: applyArt

params.name: art
params.description: The texture to set.

classitems.description: Updates the particle.
classitems.name: update

params.name: delta
params.description: Time elapsed since the previous frame, in __seconds__.

return.description:
The standard interpolation multiplier (0-1) used for all relevant particle
                  properties. A value of -1 means the particle died of old age instead.

classitems.description:
A reference to update so that subclasses can access the original without the overhead
of Function.call().
classitems.name: Particle_update

params.name: delta
params.description: Time elapsed since the previous frame, in __seconds__.

return.description:
The standard interpolation multiplier (0-1) used for all relevant particle
                  properties. A value of -1 means the particle died of old age instead.

classitems.description:
Kills the particle, removing it from the display list
and telling the emitter to recycle it.
classitems.name: kill

classitems.description: Destroys the particle, removing references and preventing future use.
classitems.name: destroy

classitems.description:
Checks over the art that was passed to the Emitter's init() function, to do any special
modifications to prepare it ahead of time.
classitems.name: parseArt

params.name: art
params.description:
The array of art data. For Particle, it should be an array of Textures.
                    Any strings in the array will be converted to Textures via
                    Texture.fromImage().

return.description: The art, after any needed modifications.

classitems.description:
Parses extra emitter data to ensure it is set up for this particle class.
Particle does nothing to the extra data.
classitems.name: parseData

params.name: extraData
params.description: The extra data from the particle config.

classitems.description: Rotates a point by a given angle.
classitems.name: rotatePoint

params.name: angle
params.description: The angle to rotate by in degrees

params.name: p
params.description: The point to rotate around 0,0.

classitems.description: Combines separate color components (0-255) into a single uint color.
classitems.name: combineRGBComponents

params.name: r
params.description: The red value of the color

params.name: g
params.description: The green value of the color

params.name: b
params.description: The blue value of the color

return.description: The color in the form of 0xRRGGBB

classitems.description: Reduces the point to a length of 1.
classitems.name: normalize

params.name: point
params.description: The point to normalize

classitems.description: Multiplies the x and y values of this point by a value.
classitems.name: scaleBy

params.name: point
params.description: The point to scaleBy

params.name: value
params.description: The value to scale by.

classitems.description: Returns the length (or magnitude) of this point.
classitems.name: length

params.name: point
params.description: The point to measure length

classitems.description:
Converts a hex string from "#AARRGGBB", "#RRGGBB", "0xAARRGGBB", "0xRRGGBB",
"AARRGGBB", or "RRGGBB" to an array of ints of 0-255 or Numbers from 0-1, as
[r, g, b, (a)].
classitems.name: hexToRGB

params.name: color
params.description: The input color string.

params.name: output
params.description: An array to put the output in. If omitted, a new array is created.

return.description: The array of numeric color values.

classitems.description:
Generates a custom ease function, based on the GreenSock custom ease, as demonstrated
by the related tool at http://www.greensock.com/customease/.
classitems.name: generateEase

params.name: segments
params.description:
An array of segments, as created by
http://www.greensock.com/customease/.

return.description:
A function that calculates the percentage of change at
                   a given point in time (0-1 inclusive).

classitems.description: Gets a blend mode, ensuring that it is valid.
classitems.name: getBlendMode

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the blend mode to get.

return.description: The blend mode as specified in the PIXI.blendModes enumeration.

classitems.description: The function representing the path the particle should take.
classitems.name: path

classitems.description:
The initial rotation in degrees of the particle, because the direction of the path
is based on that.
classitems.name: initialRotation

classitems.description: The initial position of the particle, as all path movement is added to that.
classitems.name: initialPosition

classitems.description: Total single directional movement, due to speed.
classitems.name: movement

classitems.description: A helper point for math things.
classitems.name: helperPoint

classitems.description:
Initializes the particle for use, based on the properties that have to
have been set already on the particle.
classitems.name: init

classitems.description:
Parses a string into a function for path following.
This involves whitelisting the string for safety, inserting "Math." to math function
names, and using eval() to generate a function.
classitems.name: parsePath

params.name: pathString
params.description: The string to parse.

return.description: The path function - takes x, outputs y.

classitems.description: Updates the particle.
classitems.name: update

params.name: delta
params.description: Time elapsed since the previous frame, in __seconds__.

classitems.description: Destroys the particle, removing references and preventing future use.
classitems.name: destroy

classitems.description:
Checks over the art that was passed to the Emitter's init() function, to do any special
modifications to prepare it ahead of time. This just runs Particle.parseArt().
classitems.name: parseArt

params.name: art
params.description:
The array of art data. For Particle, it should be an array of Textures.
                    Any strings in the array will be converted to Textures via
                    Texture.fromImage().

return.description: The art, after any needed modifications.

classitems.description:
Parses extra emitter data to ensure it is set up for this particle class.
PathParticle checks for the existence of path data, and parses the path data for use
by particle instances.
classitems.name: parseData

params.name: extraData
params.description: The extra data from the particle config.

classitems.description: Shuffles the array
classitems.name: shuffle

classitems.description: Get a random item from an array
classitems.name: random
